result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy M. Harris

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amy M. Harris in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Amy M. Harris. Information received. Defendant waives formal reading of Information and enters plea of NOT GUILTY. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amy M. Harris in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Amy M. Harris. Court received/reviewed PQW w/ defendant and Atty Hansen. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
